info.name: backend-v3
info.description:
Mika backend version 3 - ongoing development

## Content-type
Mika backend api **ONLY** accept and response in `application/json` media type

## Response structure
```json
{
    "version": "master-29ad0b0-35 development 2019-04-25T11:02:25.000Z",
    "status": "sys-200",
    "message": "Success",
    "isError": false,
    "data": "Welcome to backend-v3"
}
```

All response in mika backend, will contain, 

- `status`
Contain machine friendly error status code. It complement HTTP status code.

- `message`
Contain human friendly message description for `status`.

- `isError`
Telling wheter this type of response is an error or not

Optionally, it will contain,
- `version`
Contain current revison of backend, with format,

```
In Development
{{environment}} {{branch}}-{{commitHash}}-{{commitCount}} {{commitTime}}

In production
{{version}}
```

- `data`
Returned data from request or any information related to status message

- `meta`
Sometime `meta` could be included to complement `data`

## Common status code
These status code all common in all request

## System Context

- Success (Generic)
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : sys-200
- Bad request (e.g Malformed JSON Body)
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : sys-400
- URL Not Found
	- HTTP Status : 404
	- Status Code : sys-404
- Internal Server Error (Unhandled Execption)
	- HTTP Status : 500
	- Status Code : sys-500
- Bad Request, Validation error (e.g Invalid field)
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : sys-401

## Authentication Context

- Not Authenticated (Invalid session token, User is not authenticated)
	- HTTP Status : 401
	- Status Code : auth-401
- Forbidden (Authenticated User is not authorised to access endpoint)
	- HTTP Status : 403
	- Status Code : auth-403

## Entity Context

- One or more entity found
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : ent-200
- Request processed Sucessfuly but no Entity is Found
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : ent-204
- Single entity not found
	- HTTP Status : 404
	- Status Code : ent-404
- Single Entity Created
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : ent-201
- Single Entity Updated
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : ent-202
- Single Entity Deleted
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : ent-203

## Transaction context

- Invalid transaction
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-404
- Invalid acquirer configuration
	- HTTP Status : 500
	- Status Code : trx-500
- Acquirer host unavailable (retryable)
	- HTTP Status : 500
	- Status Code : trx-510
- Acquirer host unable to process (retryable)
	- HTTP Status : 500
	- Status Code : trx-511


## Authentication
Authentication is needed for all (unless noted in individual request) non-debug endpoints. To authenticate, please login via respective endpoint in **Authentication** collection.

In every request, session token needs to be included in `x-access-token` HTTP header or included as bearer style token, `Authorization: Bearer <token>`.

Mika backend uses short, 15 minutes session to adhere to PCIDSS certification. Session expiry will be renewed on every request made to aunthenticated endpoint. 

Only one session token valid for one login user, any authentication to same logged-on user will invalidate last session token.

## Debug
Debug endpoint is only available in development or staging enviroment. To authenticate, please include debug key in `x-mika-debug` http header.

## Common Query
### Prequisites : Attributes/Fields
Attributes name in `filters` and `order_by` is one to one to entity model, for example simplified `transaction` entity under agent will have,
```json
{
  "id": "1LGN6V6a7b4YGBVK5kqt3D7u8iM",
  "idAlias": "agromesupermoe-15MRA6-NCMPW5",
  "amount": 1000,
  "status": "created",
  "settlementStatus": "",
  "createdAt": "2019-05-15T08:51:39.000Z",
  "updatedAt": "2019-05-15T08:51:39.000Z",
  "transactionExtraKvs": [],
  "acquirer": {
    "id": 8,
    "name": "WeChat Pay Super Moe",
    "acquirerConfigId": 3,
    "acquirerTypeId": 4,
    "acquirerType": {
      "id": 4,
      "class": "alipay",
      "thumbnailGray": "alipay-gray.png",
      "chartColor": "#01AAEE"
    },
    "acquirerConfig": {
      "id": 3,
      "sandbox": true,
      "merchantId": null
    }
  }
}
```
to select `class` under `acquirerType`, attributes name `acquirer.acquirerType.class`can be used

### Pagination and Ordering
Pagination and ordering is supported for most plural words endpoint (e.g `/api/agent/transactions`). With an exception when resource identifier is explicitly written in endpoint (e.g `/api/agent/transactions/resourceidabc1234`).

Query parameter for pagination and ordering :
 - `page` : current page
 - `per_page` : entities per page
 - `get_count` : get total count of entites, placed in `meta`
 - `order` : order direction, `asc` for ascending and `desc` for descending
 - `order_by`: attributes in entities as order parameter

Below is an example of URL with pagination applied.
```
https://api.mikapp.id//api/agent/transactions?page=1&per_page=10&get_count=1&order=asc&order_by=createdAt
```

### Filters
Most plural endpoint provide capability to filter entities. Filters is defined as array in URL query string, with format,
`f[field]=operator,value` or `filters[field]=operator,value`.

Below is an example of URL with filters applied.
```
https://api.mikapp.id/api/agent/transactions?f[status]=eq,success&f[amount]=gt,5000
```

Supported operator
- `eq` (equal)
- `eqnull` (equal to `null`)
- `eqtrue` (equal to `true`)
- `neq` (not equal)
- `neqnull` (not equal to `null`)
- `neqtrue` (not equal to `true`)
- `lt`, `lte` (less than, less than equal)
- `gt`, `gte` (greater that, greater than equal)
- `like` (like wildcard)

Example: 
- `f[status]=eq,succes`
- `f[acquirer.name]=like,%tcash%`

All of filter will be **and**-ed together, from example above it will filter entities with `status` equal (`eq`) to `sucess` **and** `acquirer.name` `like` `%tcash%`.

For **or** operation on the same field, extra `,or` in field name can be use. For example to filter entities with value of amount from 500 to 1000, is equal to `f[amount,or]=gte,500&f[amount,or]=lte,1000` in filter query string.

request.description:
Login to mika backend

# Required Field
- `username` (String)
- `password` (String)

# Optional Field
- `userTypes` (array)
	- `userTypes` is an array of user type to enforce for user type allowed to login. If user whom login is not in `userTypes`, login will simply fail.

# Specific Status Code

- Login Successful
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : auth-200
- Invalid Credential
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : auth-400
- Password expired
 	- HTTP Status : 401
 	- Status Code : auth-420
- Too many failed authentication
 	- HTTP Status : 401
 	- Status Code : auth-421

Logout from mika backend

# Specific Status Code
- Logout Successful
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : auth-201

Change password of currently authenticated user (based on session token)

# Required Field
 - `oldPassword` (String)
 - `password` (String)

# Specific Status Code
- Password Change Succesful
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : auth-203
- Invalid Old Password
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : auth-410
- Cannot change to last used password
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : auth-412

Change password for user with expired password user ONLY.

# Required Field
 - `username` (String) 
 - `oldPassword` (String)
 - `password` (String)

# Specific Status Code
- Cannot Change Password
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : auth-411

Check session token if its still valid and renew its expiry via `sessionToken` properties. This endpoint doesnt need authentication.

# Specific Status Code
- Session Token Still Valid
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : auth-202
- Invalid Session Token
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : auth-404

# Required Field
- `sessionToken` (String)

Create new transaction with current logged-in agent.

# Required Field
- `amount` (String)
- `acquirerId` (String)

# Optional Field
- `userToken` (Object, String)
- `userTokenType` (String)
- `locationLong` (Numeric)
- `locationLat` (Numeric)
- `flags` (Array)

# Specific Status Code
- Transaction Created
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-200
- Transaction Created and Processed Successfully (`status` is `success`)
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-201
- Invalid Acquirer
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-400
- Acquirer need User Token
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-410
- Invalid User Token
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-411
- Acquirer doesn't support User Token (for Acquirer supporting more than one User Token Type)
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-412
- Ambiguous User Token (for Acquirer supporting more than one User Token Type)
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-413
- Amount too low
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-440
- Amount too high
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-441

Cancel created transaction

# Specific Status Code
- Transaction Canceled
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-203

Cancel created transaction

# Specific Status Code
- Transaction Canceled
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-203

Refund specified transaction.


# Optional Field
- `amount` (Numeric, nullable)
	- If `undefined` or `null` will refund to fully possible amount
- `reason` (String, nullable)

# Specific Status Code
- Transaction Refunded
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-205
- Transaction Partially Refunded
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-206
- Refund not supported by transaction acquirer
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-415
- Partial Refund not supported by transaction acquirer
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-416
- Invalid amount for refund (too low or too high)
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-417

Refund specified transaction.


# Optional Field
- `amount` (Numeric, nullable)
	- If `undefined` or `null` will refund to fully possible amount
- `reason` (String, nullable)

# Specific Status Code
- Transaction Refunded
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-205
- Transaction Partially Refunded
	- HTTP Status : 200
	- Status Code : trx-206
- Refund not supported by transaction acquirer
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-415
- Partial Refund not supported by transaction acquirer
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-416
- Invalid amount for refund (too low or too high)
	- HTTP Status : 400
	- Status Code : trx-417

Forcefully change transaction status in development environment.

# Required Field
- `transactionId` (String)
- `status` (String)

# Optional Field
- `syncWithAcquirerHost` (Boolean, default false)
Get transaction acquirer statistics under merchant staff

query.description: Group attribute (datetime only, e.g createdAt, updatedAt)

It able to create create/modify other admin user.
